subject: Investing
title: Social Proof and Investing
description: A 60-second lesson on Social Proof and Investing.

hook.text: A survey showed 68% of young investors bought a stock because they saw others talking about it online.

buildup.text: Social proof is the tendency to copy what others are doing, assuming the crowd must be right.

discovery.text: In investing, the crowd is often right during trends but catastrophically wrong at turning points.

twist.text: By the time a stock becomes a social media sensation, most of the gains have already happened.

climax.text: Use social proof to discover ideas, but use your own analysis to decide whether to invest.

punchline.text: The crowd discovers opportunities. It rarely knows when to leave.

quiz.question: What is social proof in investing?
